label: Description
value: Ovoid body, short neck with everted rim; painted in underglaze blue on white with American Indian smoking a pipe, next to a large jar inscribed "Schosse," large tobacco plant overhead, crates and barrels left, one inscribed "VOC," two sailing ships on right.

label: Provenance
value: R. & J. Jones, London; 1977: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Oval plaque with molded border, 2 holes at top for hanging; painted in underglaze blue on white with grotesque decoration composed of fruit, birds, mask, lambrequin; around the border with a scroll pattern covered with blue; back plain.

label: Provenance
value: R. & J. Jones, London; 1983: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Circular plate with wide rim; painted in underglaze blue on white, center with chinoiserie scene of pavillion in landscape, cavetto with diaper pattern, outer rim with dot and line border.

label: Provenance
value: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Beaker-shaped body, flared towards top, flared base; cut with wide flutes bottom, a projecting hatched ring above, bands of flutes and strawberry diamonds above that, at top a wide band of swags engraved with an inscrip- tion, strawberry diamonds and fine diamonds above; rayed flutes on bottom.

label: Description
value: Oval bowl with wide flared lip scalloped at edge; cut with star on bottom, row of printies around base; tall silver loop handle, lobed and engraved with floral motifs, ornate mounts at joining to bowl.

label: Description
value: 8-sided rectangular bowl, sides slightly flared, scalloped rim, sides cut with series of widely-spaced vertical lines; tall looped silver handle withshaped edges and engraved arabesques.

label: Description
value: Tall narrow flute on double spool stem wide flat foot; cut with vertical flat plates bottom, above with twisted panels of fine diamonds and facets.

label: Description
value: Length of damask, blue warp, white weft. Vertically symmetrical pattern with double-headed eagle, large flower in a pot and elephant. White pattern, the warp-float face of the satin. Blue background, the warp-float face of the satin.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 127 x 52.5 cm (50 x 20 11/16 in.) Repeat H x W: 35 x 11.7 cm (13 3/4 x 4 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Monochrome patterned gauze with vegetal forms and incorporating poisonous beasts, such as snakes and scorpions.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 48.6 x 57.2 cm (19 1/8 x 22 1/2 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
Garden with Classical Buildings and a Fountain

label: Description
value: Imaginary classical setting.  Fountain in pool at center of composition.  Three upside-down entwined dolphins support central jet.  Behind, on left and right, two reclinging figures with urns of water pouring into the pool.  Surrounding the pool are symmetrical arrangements of trees, terraces, and classical buildings.  Two female figures stand on terrace at right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Tobias Christ; 1986: acquired by Museum (from Armin B. Allen, Inc., New York City)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of the Port Royal Foundation

label: Description
value: Circular plate, concave center, scalloped rim. Upper surface painted in "Tobacco Leaf" pattern in pink, yellow, blue, with underglaze blue areas and gilded details. Reverse painted with underglaze blue and red floral sprigs.

label: Description
value:
Undulating vertical stripes of blue with small white flowers, alternating with wider columns of large pink roses on a white ground.

Image shown is of 1986-84-2d

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen warp, cotton weft Technique: block printed on plain weave "siamoise"

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (a): 53.3 x 45.7 cm (21 x 18 in.) Warp x Weft (b): 53.3 x 45.7 cm (21 x 18 in.) Warp x Weft (c): 53.3 x 45.7 cm (21 x 18 in.) Warp x Weft (d): 16.5 x 97.2 cm (6 1/2 x 38 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Five buildings at the World's Fair. Red, green and grey.

label: Physical description
value: Technique: roller printed on plain weave foundation

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 43 x 47 cm (16 15/16 x 18 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Diamond grid of floral rope containing 4 different scenes; hawking, hunting, and Tyrollean idyll.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: warp; 219 cm (86 1/2 in.) by weft (selvedge to selvedge): 85cm(33 1/2 in.) Pattern: Height of repeat: 17 in ( 43 cm.)                                          As printing surface was wider than the fabric, about 1 inch of the repeat  is missing.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Frederick Holdsworth, Jr.

label: Description
value:
Pattern of fantastic flowers and leaves painted in blue, blue-green, purple and white with a striped orange background, all painted on a printed grid.
Verso contains hand written information pertaining to the construction and manufacture of the textile. See Curatorial Notes field.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache over printed (intaglio) grid, on off white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: In the so-called rustic or "Adirondack twig" style.

label: Provenance
value: Edward Hulla and Marjorie Hulla; 1987: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Hulla family in memory of Mark Wilson Hulla

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Stiffened silk leaf painted in the in 'Ukiyo-e" style with the female figure of an artist sitting before a folding screen. Bamboo sticks.

label: Description
value: Long and narrow rectangle with appliqued and embroidered stylized poppies and branches at each end. Pale yellow and beige on off-white. Hemmed on four sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen foundation, linen applique, linen and mercerized cotton embroidery Technique: plain weave foundation; applique of plain weave and embroidery using stem, satin and bottonhole stitches

label: Provenance
value: Previously owned by Robert Edwards.  May have come from the estate of Louise Stickley, Fayetteville, New York, in May 1982.  Sold by Edwards at Philips auction gallery on June 27, 1987.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Notes
value: Long and narrow rectangle with appliqued and embroidered stylized poppies and branches at each end. Pale yellow and beige on off-white. Hemmed on four sides.

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Painted and gilded paper leaf. Obverse: three cartouches with figures in the Chinoiserie style. Reverse: Chinoiserie figure. Carved and painted ivory sticks stained blue at rivet; foil behind guards. Glass stone at rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Painted and gilded paper leaf, carved and painted ivory sticks with foil behind guards, glass stone at rivet

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1987: Mrs. Dorothy Warren collection; 1987: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Design of polychrome blossoms on a green and white striped background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: block printed on 4&1 satin

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 82.6 x 58.4 cm (32 1/2 x 23 in.) Repeat H x W: 81.3 x 40.6 cm (32 x 16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: A table centerpiece formed in four sections as flowing rococo scrollwork shaded in tones of iron-red, puce, yellow, blue and green. Partially draped figures in various stances each holding a taperstick in the form of an elongated white cornucopia banded in gilding.

label: Provenance
value: 1987: acquired by Museum (from Armin B. Allen)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Charles E. Sampson Memorial and General Acqusition Endowment Funds

label: Description
value: Twenty-three examples of cords. Trimmings and watch fobs sewn onto a cardboard card. Three examples are sewn to small pieces of paper with notes in German.

label: Physical description
value: Technique: 1 cord made of twisted wool, 2 fringes made with a sewing technique, the rest made with knotting and braiding techniques.

label: Dimensions
value: Height of card: 23.5cm (9 1/4in.). Width of card:24.5cm (9 5/8in.).

label: Description
value: The central figure is a Bodhisattva made by needle looping in the 13th century. The figure was later sewn to a ground of Chinese light blue silk satin with a gold pattern of chrysanthemums on a curving vine. The standard is made from various woven silk and metallic brocades, sewn in tab-like forms to surround the Bodhisattva. A silk tassel finishes the bottom.

label: Object Type
value: Altar and altar component coverings and hangings

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal threads, paper Technique: the bodhisattva is needle looping technique; the hanging is made from various woven fabrics sewn together

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition Fund

label: Notes
value: The central figure is a Bodhisattva made by needle looping in the 13th century. The figure was later sewn to a ground of Chinese light blue silk satin with a gold pattern of chrysanthemums on a curving vine. The standard is made from various woven silk and metallic brocades, sewn in tab-like forms to surround the Bodhisattva. A silk tassel finishes the bottom.

label: Description
value: Large white damask napkin commemorating the marriage of Louis XIV and Marie-Therese in 1660.

label: Description
value: Pair of open ironwork bracelets, each one a wide, flexible, linked band formed of three quatrefoil-and-foliate forms alternating with rosettes, all in the Gothic style; simple rectangular clasp at one end; quatrefoil-and-foliate form with rosette on oval panel at other end, to receive clasp.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Fund

label: Notes
value: Pair of open ironwork bracelets, each one a wide, flexible, linked band formed of three quatrefoil-and-foliate forms alternating with rosettes, all in the Gothic style; simple rectangular clasp at one end; quatrefoil-and-foliate form with rosette on oval panel at other end, to receive clasp.
Title page, "Insectes d'Europe, Pients d'apres nature," by J.J. Ernst

label: Description
value: Highly ornamented fireplace with figures, animals, and vegetal forms.
